intro: Phyllolepidum cyclocarpum subsp. cyclocarpum, commonly known as the cyclocarpous phyllolepidum, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a small, annual herb characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
